title: 50-C
statement: C. Happy Farm 5time limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutThe Happy Farm 5 creators decided to invent the mechanism of cow grazing. The cows in the game are very slow and they move very slowly, it can even be considered that they stand still. However, carnivores should always be chased off them.For that a young player Vasya decided to make the shepherd run round the cows along one and the same closed path. It is very important that the cows stayed strictly inside the area limited by the path, as otherwise some cows will sooner or later be eaten. To be absolutely sure in the cows' safety, Vasya wants the path completion time to be minimum.The new game is launched for different devices, including mobile phones. That's why the developers decided to quit using the arithmetics with the floating decimal point and use only the arithmetics of integers. The cows and the shepherd in the game are represented as points on the plane with integer coordinates. The playing time is modeled by the turns. During every turn the shepherd can either stay where he stands or step in one of eight directions: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. As the coordinates should always remain integer, then the length of a horizontal and vertical step is equal to1, and the length of a diagonal step is equal to. The cows do not move. You have to minimize the number of moves the shepherd needs to run round the whole herd.InputThe first line contains an integerNwhich represents the number of cows in the herd (1 ≤N≤ 105). Each of the nextNlines contains two integersXiandYiwhich represent the coordinates of one cow of (|Xi|, |Yi| ≤ 106). Several cows can stand on one point.OutputPrint the single number — the minimum number of moves in the sought path.ExamplesInput41 15 15 31 3Output16NotePicture for the example test: The coordinate grid is painted grey, the coordinates axes are painted black, the cows are painted red and the sought route is painted green.

You are given a set of points on a 2D plane. Each point represents a cow.  You need to find the shortest path that visits each cow exactly once, starting and ending at the same point.  You can move one unit horizontally, vertically, or diagonally in each step.

Input:

* The first line contains an integer $N$ representing the number of cows.
* The next $N$ lines each contain two integers $X_i$ and $Y_i$ representing the coordinates of a cow.

Output:

* Print a single integer representing the minimum number of steps required to visit all cows.

You are given a set of points on a grid. Find the shortest path that visits each point exactly once and returns to the starting point.  You can move one unit horizontally, vertically, or diagonally at a time.
